block.comment: You do not need to modify or understand this script! This simply allows you to use regions of the stage to control the board movement. Connect the script below and try it on a mobile device!
These are simple wrappers to share to with the touch controls above.
This is simply a background. You don't need to do anything in this sprite.

custom-block.comment: extra credit: Add better visual confirmation here!

scripts.comment: You don't need to change ANYTHING in this sprite! If you correctly fill out the grey functions, the game will work.

custom-block.comment: Merge up: We decided to test 'merge up' because much of the backbone of the game relies on this reporter to work. It is a useful test because this block deals with one of the more conceptually difficult aspects of the game so having it written out like this helps us visualize how the block should work.

Merge column up: It was really important to test 'merge column up' because it would not have made sense to make 'merge up' if the column function did not work in the first place. Thus, If it wasn't tested before merge up, if there was a mistake with our code, we would've had to debug both 'merge up' and 'merge column up' which would've a poor use of our time and effort while also being poorly organized. Additionally, this test verifies that the input of 'merge up' is a board and the output is a list.

No moves left: Testing 'no moves left' is pivotal because we wanted to make sure that the game ended not just when all spots in the board were filled, but also when there were no blocks that could've been combined. Additionally, it is a useful block to test because it allows us to visually conceptualize how and when the game should end. We tested both when the answer should've been 'true' and when it should've been 'false' to make sure it would not just always return 'true' even when it should've be false.

Rotate clockwise: Like 'merge up,' 'rotate clockwise' is another backbone aspect of the game because with every move that the player makes, the board should rotate behind the scenes accordingly and work with the other blocks. Like the other blocks, having a test on 'rotate clockwise' is important because it allows us to visualize exactly how the board should move when that can be mentally difficult to comprehend.

scripts.comment: ============================================== These are your graded test cases! For four out of five of the required blocks you must have 2 different sets of input and expected output. Additionally, each function should have a brief comment explaining why your test cases are good / useful. You are more than welcome to add as many tests as you like, for additional blocks, as long as you meet the requirements above. We strongly recommend that you write tests BEFORE each block!! .
This is a tester sprite! You should expand the test cases here, by adding items to the input and output lists, and attaching comments to blocks explaining your ideas.

block.comment: There are four grey functions to fill out to make this game work.
This test ensures that the item of block correctly reports the items at locations (1, 4) and (1, 2)

custom-block.comment: For you to run! This test should fail, since 2 + 4 does not equal 5.
This tests that new boards are created with the right size.
This tests whether 5 - 2 = 3, which should report true.

scripts.comment: EXAMPLES: These tester blocks take in a reporter -- something that you want to test. The inputs are what you would want to pass into the reporter as a test. The output is what you expect the reporter to output when passed in the input(s). The block will report a Boolean based on whether your test passed. Note: You must leave the inputs to the block you are testing empty.

block.comment: This test ensures that the item of block correctly reports the items at locations (1, 4) and (1, 2)
From lab: Fill in what the output should be for the following test case for "merge up". In HW3, you'll add more of your own "merge up" test cases.

scripts.comment: From lab: fill in two of your own tests for the "merge column up" block. Refer to our tests of "item of" and "+" above to remember how to deal with "merge column up" needing multiple inputs.

block-definition.comment: This is a game board which is expected to be square.
This creates a new empty board of n by n tiles
This is just like the ITEM OF block, but for our game board. You don't need to know how it works.
This is just like the REPLACE block, but for our game board. You don't need to know how it works.
This returns a new distinct copy of the input board which will help prevent you from accidentally reseting list items.
The block reports the score of an individual tile.
Returns a list of locations in board which are empty. The locations are length 2 lists as [row, col].

custom-block.s: speak %s with %txt accent %br and pitch %n rate %n

block-definition.s: speak %'text' with %'lang' accent $nl and pitch %'pitch' rate %'rate'
block-definition.translations: de:sprich _ mit _ Aussprache _ und Hhe _ Geschwindigkeit _ pt:fala _ na lngua _ _ com tom _ e velocidade _

inputs.input: en-US=ar =bg =bn Catal=ca Catal - Valenci=ca-VA esky=cs Deutsch=de Dansk=dk =el English-American=en-US English-British=en-GB Esperanto=eo Espaol=es Eesti=et Euskara=eu suomi=fi Franais=fr Galego=gl Hrvatski=hr Magyar=hu Interlingua=ia Bahasa Indonesia=id Italiano=it =ja =ja-HIRA =kn =ko Malayalam=ml Nederlands=nl Norsk=no Polski=pl Portugus=pt Portugus do Brasil=pt-BR Romn=ro =ru Slovenina=si svenska=sv Tamil=ta Telagu=te Trke=tr =ua =zh-CN =zh-TW

block.l: var utter = new SpeechSynthesisUtterance(msg); utter.lang = accent; utter.pitch = pitch; utter.rate = rate; window.speechSynthesis.speak(utter);

block-definition.s: speak %'text' with %'lang' accent $nl and pitch %'pitch' rate %'rate' and wait
block-definition.translations: de:sprich _ mit _ Aussprache _ und Hhe _ Geschwindigkeit _ und warte pt:fala _ na lngua _ _ com tom _ e velocidade _ , e espera

inputs.input: en-US=ar =bg =bn Catal=ca Catal - Valenci=ca-VA esky=cs Deutsch=de Dansk=dk =el English-American=en-US English-British=en-GB Esperanto=eo Espaol=es Eesti=et Euskara=eu suomi=fi Franais=fr Galego=gl Hrvatski=hr Magyar=hu Interlingua=ia Bahasa Indonesia=id Italiano=it =ja =ja-HIRA =kn =ko Malayalam=ml Nederlands=nl Norsk=no Polski=pl Portugus=pt Portugus do Brasil=pt-BR Romn=ro =ru Slovenina=si svenska=sv Tamil=ta Telagu=te Trke=tr =ua =zh-CN =zh-TW

block.l: var utter = new SpeechSynthesisUtterance(msg), isDone = false; utter.lang = accent; utter.pitch = pitch; utter.rate = rate; utter.onend = function () {isDone = true; }; window.speechSynthesis.speak(utter); return function () {return isDone; };
